title: Family Time Capsule
description: Gather meaningful items, letters to future selves, and photos. Seal them in a box to open next year!

title: The 10-Minute Dance Party
description: Put on everyone's favorite song, clear the living room floor, and have a spontaneous, energetic dance battle.

title: Family Skill Swap Session
description: Everyone teaches one small skill (e.g., a simple origami fold, a magic trick, how to tie a knot) to the rest of the family.

title: Neighborhood Scavenger Hunt
description: Create a list of common items (e.g., a red door, a black cat, a flower, a street sign) and take a walk to find them.

title: Cook-Off: Pantry Edition
description: Each family member finds one item in the pantry/fridge. Together, try to invent a meal using only those items.

title: Family Story Circle
description: Start a story with one sentence. The next person adds a sentence, continuing around the circle until the story is finished.

title: Pillow Fort / Indoor Camping
description: Use blankets, pillows, and chairs to build a huge fort. Bring flashlights and read a book inside.

title: Board Game or Card Game Marathon
description: Choose a few favorite board games or card games and play them back-to-back. Losers make the popcorn!

title: Gratitude Jar Update
description: Decorate a jar. Each family member writes one thing they are grateful for today and puts it in the jar.

title: DIY Puppet Show
description: Use old socks, paper bags, or gloves to create puppets, then write a short play to perform for each other.

title: Family Vision Board
description: Cut pictures from old magazines (or draw) and paste them onto a poster board representing family goals and dreams.

title: Star Gazing or Cloud Watching
description: Lay outside at night and look for constellations, or during the day, look for shapes in the clouds. Discuss what you see!

title: Indoor/Outdoor Obstacle Course
description: Use pillows, ropes, chairs, and blankets to design a fun obstacle course everyone has to complete.

title: Write Letters to Grandparents
description: Write and draw cards or letters to family members who live far away to stay connected.

title: Memory Lane Photo Session
description: Open old photo albums on a device or in print. Share the stories behind the pictures and talk about how everyone has grown.
